data.title: Mean Julian
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read ROW:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] that is the number of names that Julian is meeting
<<[[n]] next lines>> Strings that contains the names
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] lines>> that says if Julian is going to be {{MEAN}} or {{NICE}} with the corresponding person

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A Julian is someone that like being unique. He is very mean to people who have the same vowel in their name and in the same order. Otherwise, Julian feels unique thus he's quite nice. The goal is to determine, given the name of a person, if Julian is going to be mean or nice.

Warning: Julian treats name case insensitively and he doesn't care about non alphabetical characters in names like: '-'

For example:
* "Robert" contains 2 vowels that are not in "Julian" so Julian will be NICE
* "Maximus" contains the same vowels as in "Julian" but not in the right order so he's going to act NICE
* "Rudiha" contains the same vowels as in "Julian" and in the same order thus Julian is going to be MEAN
* "Luhucianna" contains the same vowels as in "Julian" and in the right order. Even if some vowels are duplicated, Julian will still feel not unique so he'll be MEAN
Input
Line 1: An integer n that is the number of names that Julian is meeting
n next lines Strings that contains the names
Output
n lines that says if Julian is going to be MEAN or NICE with the corresponding person
Constraints
1≤n<10
Example
Input
1
Robert
Output
NICE
